snippet: Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver said Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s office should have a smaller role in a proposed state agency for people with disabilities.
abstract: New York State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver says that Gov Andrew M Cuomo's office should have a lesser role in a new state agency proposed to police the abuse and neglect of people with disabilities; insists that the executive branch has long failed to adequately oversee problems within its own agencies that provide services to people with developmental disabilities and mental illnesses.
lead_paragraph: Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver said Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s office should have a smaller role in a proposed state agency for people with disabilities.

headline.seo: Assembly Speaker Presses Cuomo on Plan for Disabled Care
headline.main: Silver Presses Governor on Proposal for Disabled
headline.print_headline: Silver Presses Governor On Proposal For Disabled
